snippet: Fighters of the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, a magnet for militants from around the world, have a religious conviction and canny business sense.
abstract: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, militant Sunni group with thousands of fighters, is on the rise, having occupied crucial swatches of Syria and now surging into northern Iraq; vows to create a caliphate spanning the Sunni-dominated sections of neighboring countries, and is magnet for militants from around world.

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

lead_paragraph: Fighters of the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, a magnet for militants from around the world, have a religious conviction and canny business sense.

headline.main: Sunni Fighters Gain as They Battle 2 Governments, and Other Rebels
headline.print_headline: Sunni Fighters Gain as They Battle 2 Governments, and Other Rebels

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
